results.title: Route des Cimes
results.brief_description: A road tanker’s daily hazardous climb up the snowbound mountainside to the village of Val d’Isere whose hotels, hospitals and homes are dependent upon its cargo for fuel. Contrasting with the upward grind of the tanker are exhilarating scenes of skiers skimming down from the slopes above Val d’Isere, breaking a new trail from the mountain tops to the village.

results.title: Roustabout
results.creator_credit: Hal B Wallis, Paramount Pictures and John Rich
results.brief_description: The year is 1964, and the mini-skirt is in. Charlie Rogers is a coffee-house singer who joins a financially troubled carnival. He is hired by owner, Maggie Morgan, and soon catches the eye of his pretty female co-worker, Cathy Lean. Cathy’s irate father, Joe, clashes with Charlie when he tries to romance his daughter, but Charlie’s singing and looks helps bring in the much-needed money for the near-bankrupt carnival. Cast includes Elvis Presley, Barbara Stanwyck, Joan Freeman and Leif Erickson.

results.title: Roundabout
results.creator_credit: Igloo Films, 3rd Pictures, Jason Byrne, Louise Smith and Rachel Griffiths
results.brief_description: A stressed businessman experiences a panic attack after he hits a dog in his car on his way to work. Spiralling out of control he drives in endless circles, unable to stop. Photography, Tristan Milani ; music, David Bridie ; editing, Geordie Anderson. Cast: David Roberts, Alison Whyte, Kym Gyngell.

results.title: Roundabout
results.creator_credit: Churchill Films, Leah Miller and Pieter Van Deusen
results.brief_description: Presents a story about a young boy’s experience with an old man who owns a magical toy merry-go-round and tells what happens when it is stolen by the boy’s friends. Designed to stimulate discussion about responsibility and consideration for others. Suitable for lower primary level.

results.title: Round the world by air
results.brief_description: A film record of the delivery flight of the first Convair Aircraft purchased by Trans-Australia Airlines. The aircraft travelled 18,000 miles in 72 hours on its round-the-world trip, passing over 25 countries on its flight from San Diego, USA, to Melbourne. Photography by Geoffrey Thompson.

results.title: Round the Twist: Series 1
results.creator_credit: Patricia Edgar, Paul Jennings, Esben Storm and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
An international award winning Australian comedy series based on the stories of celebrated children’s author, Paul Jennings. Each of the stories told in the thirteen self-contained episodes of Series 1 follows the adventures of the Twist kids – Pete, Linda, Bronson – who have moved to the coastal town of Port Niranda with their Dad. Living in a haunted lighthouse, they encounter bizarre magical devices, neurotic ghosts, rampaging entrepreneurs and sneering school bullies.
A uniquely quirky kid’s TV series loved by generations of the young-at-heart.

results.title: Round the twist Series 4 - Volume 7 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, Patricia Edgar, Helen Watts, Esben Storm, Ray Boseley and Arnie Custo
results.brief_description: The Twist family - 13-year-old twins Pete and Linda, their 8-year-old brother Bronson and their single Dad, Tony - move to an old lighthouse on the Australian coast. Here they encounter some unusual characters and strange happenings in a series of weird and comic adventures. Each episode is a self-contained story with a surprise ending, guaranteed to send you “round the twist”. In “Hair Brain” Linda gets an advantage in her campaign for election to the student council after a weird experience with hair products. In “The Princess and the Pete” Pete finds the course of true love doesn’t run smoothly. “Boy Bird” has Bronson discovering a magical singer; while in “The Shadow Player” Linda gets some bad news from her own shadow. “Radio Da Da” sends Linda and Peter time travelling, and Bronson performs good but smelly deeds as “Skunkman”. In “Isle of Dreams” the Twists meet the Princess of Atlantis and have a difficult decision to make. Based on the books by Paul Jennings.

results.title: Round the twist Series 4 - Volume 6 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, Patricia Edgar, Helen Watts, Esben Storm, Ray Boseley and Arnie Custo
results.brief_description: The Twist family - 13-year-old twins Pete and Linda, their 8-year-old brother Bronson and their single Dad, Tony - move to an old lighthouse on the Australian coast. Here they encounter some unusual characters and strange happenings in a series of weird and comic adventures. Each episode is a self-contained story with a surprise ending, guaranteed to send you “round the twist”. In “Welcome Back”, the ghosts see their chance to stage a comeback in the play being performed to celebrate Port Niranda’s bicentenary. In “Monster Under the Bed” the Lintmonster under Bronson’s bed demonstrates the dire consequences of neglecting the cleaning. In “Linda Godiva”, Linda becomes invisible. Peter turns into a werewolf in “Dog By Night”. In “TV Or Not TV” all the Twist kids get (literally) sucked into their TV. “Face The Fear” has Bronson colliding with hidden loot, ghosts and escaped convicts in the local cemetery. Based on the books by Paul Jennings.

results.title: Round the twist Series 3 - Volume 5 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, Bernadette O'Mahony, Patricia Edgar, Esben Storm, Ray Boseley and Pino Amenta
results.brief_description: The Twist family - 13-year-old twins Pete and Linda, their 8-year-old brother Bronson and their single Dad, Tony - move to an old lighthouse on the Australian coast. Here they encounter some unusual characters and strange happenings in a series of weird and comic adventures. Each episode is a self-contained story with a surprise ending, guaranteed to send you “round the twist”. In “Mali Boo”, Tony discovers an old Malibu surfboard in the garage, and Pete is keen to make a splash at the Port Niranda surf carnival, that is until the board’s real owner shows up. In “Brainless”, Bronson teams up with resident geek Anthony for a science project that ends up with Pete and Linda having their brains sucked out their noses. While Bronson is searching for their brains at the local tip, Linda and Pete’s bodies become Gribbles’ personal slaves. In “Toy Love”, Linda’s old Veronique doll comes back to haunt her, refusing to leave her alone, and neither will Gribble who has heard Linda read from the Viking Book of Love. In “The Tears Of Innocence”, Port Niranda is in the middle of a drought when days before the annual flower show, Derek the rainmaker arrives. In “The Ice Cream Man Cometh”, Linda is sacked from Mr. Gribble’s ice cream parlor, so she finds work with Paulo the master ice cream maker. In “If The Walls Could Talk”, Bronson feels left out because no-one ever tells him anything, thinking he is too young. If only the walls could talk he sighs, and then they begin to - the challenge is to make them be quiet again. In “The Big Rock”, Gribbles gets his hands on the Viking Book of Love and reads the final poem, accidentally unleashing a curse which turns Faye into a frog. Based on the books by Paul Jennings.

results.title: Round the twist Series 3 - Volume 4 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, Bernadette O'Mahony, Patricia Edgar, Esben Storm, Ray Boseley and Pino Amenta
results.brief_description: The Twist family - 13-year-old twins Pete and Linda, their 8-year-old brother Bronson and their single Dad, Tony - move to an old lighthouse on the Australian coast. Here they encounter some unusual characters and strange happenings in a series of weird and comic adventures. Each episode is a self-contained story with a surprise ending, guaranteed to send you “round the twist”. In “The Big Burp”, Pete finally meets the girl of his dreams. He can’t believe his luck - Jeannie is the most beautiful girl in Port Niranda - even if she is a tree spirit. Pete is also very surprised to find that he has somehow fallen pregnant. In “The Viking Book of Love”, a long boat of ancient Vikings, led by chef Snorri, emerges from an eerie fog which is enveloping Port Niranda, however the real trouble begins when the chief’s son, Snorrisen, falls in love with Linda after he reads to her from the Viking Book of Love. “The Whirling Derfish” sees Bronson swallow a rare whirling derfish, causing his willy to spin like a propellor turning him into a human outboard motor known as “The Port Niranda Porpoise”. In “Umi”, Pete’s mind is trapped in Gribble’s body and vice versa, due to a particularly realistic video game they played. While Pete is spending a nasty night with Matron Gribble, Gribble is trying to convince Tony to sell the lighthouse. In “Truth Hits Everybody”, Linda loses out to Gribble as the host of the Port Niranda High School Broadcast, so she decides to do her own show. Anthony, Fiona, Pete and Linda find a magic microphone that makes everyone speak the truth, which is not always a good thing. In “Niranderthal Boy”, the tradition in the Twist household of the razor being passed on from father to elder son is broken when Bronson uses it before Pete - thus chaos is unleashed and the consequences can only be dangerous. Based on the books by Paul Jennings.

Each episode is a self-contained story with a surprise ending, guaranteed to send you “round the twist”. In “The Big Burp”, Pete finally meets the girl of his dreams. He can’t believe his luck - Jeannie is the most beautiful girl in Port Niranda - even if she is a tree spirit. Pete is also very surprised to find that he has somehow fallen pregnant. In “The Viking Book of Love”, a long boat of ancient Vikings, led by chef Snorri, emerges from an eerie fog which is enveloping Port Niranda, however the real trouble begins when the chief’s son, Snorrisen, falls in love with Linda after he reads to her from the Viking Book of Love. “The Whirling Derfish” sees Bronson swallow a rare whirling derfish, causing his willy to spin like a propellor turning him into a human outboard motor known as “The Port Niranda Porpoise”. In “Umi”, Pete’s mind is trapped in Gribble’s body and vice versa, due to a particularly realistic video game they played. While Pete is spending a nasty night with Matron Gribble, Gribble is trying to convince Tony to sell the lighthouse. In “Truth Hits Everybody”, Linda loses out to Gribble as the host of the Port Niranda High School Broadcast, so she decides to do her own show. Anthony, Fiona, Pete and Linda find a magic microphone that makes everyone speak the truth, which is not always a good thing. In “Niranderthal Boy”, the tradition in the Twist household of the razor being passed on from father to elder son is broken when Bronson uses it before Pete - thus chaos is unleashed and the consequences can only be dangerous. Based on the books by Paul Jennings.
